meanings.definition: An activity involving physical exertion and skill in which an individual or team competes against another or others for entertainment.
meanings.sent1: Playing a sport like soccer requires running and kicking a ball.
meanings.sent2: Watching sports on TV is a popular pastime for many people.
meanings.sent3: During the picnic, the ants seemed to have a sport of their own, racing around the food.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her craft was a sport that few could match.
meanings.sent5: The stadium was alive with the energy of the sport being played.

meanings.definition: To wear or display in an ostentatious or proud manner.
meanings.sent1: She liked to sport her new sunglasses whenever she went out.
meanings.sent2: The peacock sported its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to sport a mischievous grin after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: He sported a confident attitude that impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The car sported a shiny new coat of paint that caught everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To amuse oneself or play in a lively, energetic way.
meanings.sent1: Children love to sport around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: The puppies sported with each other in the yard, full of energy.
meanings.sent3: The old man decided to sport with the kids, joining their game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The siblings sported in the snow, building a snowman together.
meanings.sent5: The friends sported at the beach, enjoying the sun and waves.
